types.name: Query
types.description: The basic set of queries you can perform

fields.name: community

fields.name: general
fields.description: General category which includes all fields that don't fit into any other category

fields.description: Lend category which includes all fields related to lending

args.description: The id of the basket to use for child fields. Optional, though some fields will throw an error if it is not defined.

types.name: Community
types.description: Community category which includes all fields related to community

fields.name: lender
fields.description: Returns lender by publicId

fields.description: Returns team by id or teamPublicId (must specify one, will default to id)

types.name: String
types.description:
The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8
character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to
represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Lender
types.description: Representation of a Kiva lender

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for a lender

fields.name: image
fields.description: The lender's image

fields.name: inviteeCount
fields.description: The number of registered users invited by this lender

fields.name: lenderPage
fields.description: The lender's lender page details

fields.name: loanCount
fields.description: The total number of loans made by this lender

fields.name: loans

fields.name: teams

types.name: Int
types.description:
The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric
values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

fields.description: A MD5 hash of the image file

fields.name: width
fields.description: The width of the original image file

fields.name: url
fields.description: You can specify either a common image size enum, or a custom size, to get an image url

args.name: presetSize
args.description: A set of common image sizes

args.name: customSize
args.description: Specify your own custom size. To get a square use 's' and pixels per side (ie s100). To get a rectangle use 'h' for height and 'w' for width (ie h100w200)

types.name: ImageSizeEnum

The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional

types.name: LoanBasic
types.description: The basic loans fields that are in common between partner and direct loans

fields.name: activity
fields.description: The activity is a structured categorization of the loan use

fields.name: anonymizationLevel
fields.description: The level of borrower privacy

fields.name: borrowerCount
fields.description: The number of borrowers participating in the loan

fields.name: borrowers
fields.description: The one or more borrowers that are receiving this loan. If there is more than one, the primary borrower is first

fields.name: dafEligible
fields.description: Whether or not the loan is eligible for donor-advised funds.

fields.name: delinquent
fields.description: Whether or not the loan is delinquent. This defaults to false if the user is not privileged to this loan

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the loan profile in English.

fields.name: descriptionInOriginalLanguage
fields.description: The description of the loan profile in the original language of its posting

fields.name: disbursalDate
fields.description: The date on which the loan was/will actually be disbursed to the borrower

fields.name: distributionModel
fields.description: How the loan is distributed to the borrower, e.g. 'field_partner' or 'direct'

fields.name: endorser
fields.description: The user who endorsed the loan. Only shown on fundRaising loans, null for all other statuses.

fields.name: fundraisingDate
fields.description: When the loan started fundraising on Kiva. Same as posted_date in v1.

fields.name: gender
fields.description: The gender of the primary borrower OR majority gender if group

fields.name: geocode
fields.description: The physical location of the borrower and/or business

fields.name: hasCurrencyExchangeLossLenders
fields.description: Whether or not the loan has currency loss to lenders

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for a Kiva loan

fields.name: image
fields.description: The picture for this loan profile.

fields.name: isMatchable
fields.description: Is this Kiva loan matchable? e.g. is there a source of funds to provide matching if a share is purchased?

fields.name: inPfp
fields.description: If true, this loan is in a Private Fundraising Period

fields.name: loanAmount
fields.description: The amount of this loan, as shown to lenders

fields.name: loanFundraisingInfo
fields.description: Information about this loan during its fundraising period

fields.name: lenderRepaymentTerm
fields.description: The number of months it will take the borrower to repay the loan

fields.name: matcherName
fields.description: The name of the loan matcher

fields.name: matchingText
fields.description: Text that is displayed if loan matching is turned on for this loan.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the borrower or group receiving the loan

fields.name: paidAmount
fields.description: The amount of settled repayments for a loan that has started paying back

fields.name: pfpMinLenders
fields.description: The minimum number of lenders that this loan needs to exit its private fundraising period (PFP).

fields.name: plannedExpirationDate
fields.description: When the loan will expire if it is not fully funded

fields.name: previousLoanId
fields.description: ID of the loan linked as previous to this one.

fields.name: raisedDate
fields.description: When the loan became raised, e.g. fully funded. Same as funded_date in v1

fields.name: researchScore
fields.description: The research score of the loan theme instance of the loan

fields.name: repaymentInterval
fields.description: The repayment interval of the loan: "monthly", "irregularly","at_end"

fields.name: sector
fields.description: The sector is a more general classification of the loan than activity

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of a loan

fields.name: tags
fields.description: A list of tags on this loan

fields.name: terms
fields.description: The financial terms of this loan

fields.description: Text describing what the loan is to be used for; a logical subset of description e.g. "To buy a cow"

fields.name: video

fields.description: Why this loan is considered special.

types.name: Activity
types.description: A property of loan which is more descriptive than Sector. Every activity is within a sector. e.g. the 'Animal Sales' activity is within the 'Agriculture' sector. Note, some Activities have the same name as their parent Sector

fields.description: Unique identifier for this activity

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the activity

fields.name: name

types.name: LoanStatusEnum
types.description: All possible loan statuses, including those that are only available to privileged users (ie lender or borrower)

types.name: LoanTerm
types.description: LoanTerms is a composite object defining the terms of a loan

fields.name: currency
fields.description: The ISO code of the currency this loan is disbursed in

fields.name: currencyFullName
fields.description: The full name of the currency this loan is disbursed in

fields.name: disbursalAmount
fields.description: The actual amount of money, in local currency, disbursed to the borrower(s)

fields.name: disbursalDate
fields.description: The date on which the partner disbursed and/or intends to disburse the loan to the borrower

fields.name: expectedPayments
fields.description: An array of payments that we expect the borrower to pay during the life of the loan. This defaults to an empty array if the user is not privileged to the loan

fields.name: loanAmount
fields.description: The amount of this loan, as shown to lenders. This amount is generated by converting the disbursalAmount to USD and then rounding up to the nearest $25

fields.name: lenderRepaymentTerm
fields.description: A simplified version of the expectedPayments info, expressed as a number of months, rounded up to the nearest month

fields.name: lossLiabilityCurrencyExchange
fields.description: If the foreign currency becomes devalued, is the loss eaten by partner, lender, or shared between partner and lender?  This field will be 'none' when the loan is in USD.

fields.name: lossLiabilityNonpayment
fields.description: If the borrower doesn't repay, who loses out: the partner or the lender?

fields.name: flexibleFundraisingEnabled
fields.description: Whether the flexible fundraising is enabled for this loan as of now.

types.name: RepaymentExpected
types.description: RepaymentExpecteds are payments that the borrower is expected to pay during the life of the loan

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount of principal for this payment, typically in USD. The loan amount for Kiva

fields.name: dueToKivaDate
fields.description: The date by which this payment should be repaid. This is dependent on Kiva's billing cycle, and may be pushed back. Same as due_date on scheduled_payments in v1

fields.name: effectiveDate
fields.description: The date as of which this payment should be included in calculations. Could be before or after it's actually added to the Loan object. Same as due_date on local_payments in v1

fields.name: localAmount
fields.description: The amount of principal for this payment, in the currency that it was disbursed by the partner. The true amount of the loan the borrower received

types.name: ID
types.description:
The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to
refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON
response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable.
When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer
(such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Partner
types.description: Representation of a Kiva partner

fields.name: arrearsRate
fields.description: A decimal representing the percentage of the partner’s outstanding portfolio which is overdue

fields.name: avgLoanSizePercentPerCapitaIncome
fields.description: A ratio of the partner's average loan size to the per capita income of the country they work in, e.g. if average loan size is $400 and the GDP/capita is $800 the value would be 0.5

fields.name: avgBorrowerCost
fields.description: Average cost incurred by the borrowers for this partner (eg interest rate + other fees)

fields.name: avgBorrowerCostType
fields.description: type of borrower cost (eg 'APR', 'PY', 'MPR', etc)

fields.name: avgBorrowerCostNote
fields.description: short note explaining the borrower cost to lenders

fields.name: chargesFeesInterest
fields.description: A true/false property for whether the partner charges fees and/or interest to borrowers

fields.name: countries
fields.description: A list of countries in which the partner operates and posts loans on Kiva

fields.name: currencyExchangeLossRate
fields.description: The percentage of loans for which losses have been realized due to currency fluctuations (amount of currency exchange loss / total toans).

fields.name: defaultRate
fields.description: A decimal representing the percentage of the partner’s funds which were raised but ended in default

fields.name: defaultRateNote
fields.description: A Kiva-supplied note that is shown in lieu of default rate

fields.name: delinquencyRateNote
fields.description: A Kiva-supplied note that is shown in lieu of delinquency rate

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the partner

fields.name: image
fields.description: An image suitable for representing the partner (usually the logo)

fields.name: loanAlertText
fields.description: An extra bit of text to be added to the bottom of all loan profiles for this partner

fields.name: loansAtRiskRate
fields.description: A decimal representing the percentage of the partner’s outstanding portfolio which is overdue but not yet repaid; delinquent means any repayment not paid in full by its due date

fields.name: loansPosted
fields.description: The number of loans raised by the partner on Kiva

fields.name: missionStatement
fields.description: The mission statement of the partner

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the partner

fields.name: portfolioYieldNote
fields.description: A Kiva-supplied note that is shown in lieu of portfolio yield

fields.name: reasonWhyNarrative
fields.description: A paragraph or two written by Kiva staff, about why Kiva is working with this partner

fields.name: riskRating
fields.description: The risk rating of the partner, represented as a fractional number of stars

fields.name: startDate
fields.description: The date the partner began posting loans publicly on Kiva

fields.name: statementType
fields.description: 'net_billing' or 'dual_statement'

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the partner’s relationship with Kiva

fields.name: totalAmountRaised
fields.description: The total amount of all loans in raised, payingBack, ended or defaulted statuses (in USD)

fields.name: loans
fields.description: A collection of loans this partner has posted

types.name: _FieldSet
types.description: A special type of string that represents a set of fields

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).

directives.name: key
directives.description: The @key directive is used to indicate a combination of fields that can be used to uniquely identify and fetch an object or interface.

args.name: fields
args.description: Fields used to uniquely identify and fetch object or interface

directives.name: external
directives.description: The @external directive is used to mark a field as owned by another service. This allows service A to use fields from service B while also knowing at runtime the types of that field.

directives.name: provides
directives.description: The @provides directive is used to annotate the expected returned fieldset from a fieldon a base type that is guaranteed to be selectable by the gateway

args.name: fields
args.description: Fields that will be provided from a field on the base type

directives.name: requires
directives.description: The @requires directive is used to annotate the required input fieldset from a base type for a resolver. It is used to develop a query plan where the required fields may not be needed by the client, but the service may need additional information from other services.

args.name: fields
args.description: Fields that are required
